alert.note: Alert for Boone (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 3:31PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF OHIO, SOUTHERN DEARBORN, NORTHERN SWITZERLAND AND BOONE COUNTIES THROUGH 400 PM EDT... At 331 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located 9 miles southwest of Dillsboro, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Cincinnati, Florence, Independence, Erlanger, Elsmere, Villa Hills, Aurora, Rising Sun, Oakbrook, Burlington, Union, Pleasant, French, Hartford, Fairview, Center Square, Aberdeen, Richwood, Idlewild and Big Bone Lick. This includes I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 175 and 183. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM EDT for southeastern Indiana...northern Kentucky...and southwestern Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
